docs.lead_paragraph: Some moderate Republican and independent women — a key swing group — have felt alienated by the focus in the presidential race on abortion and birth control.

headline.main: Centrist Women Tell of Disenchantment With Republicans
headline.print_headline: Centrist Women Tell of Disenchantment With G.O.P.

docs.abstract: Some moderate Republican and independent women--a key swing group--have felt alienated by the Republican focus in the presidential race on social issues like abortion and birth control; some of them say they might switch sides and vote for Pres Obama, if they vote at all.
docs.snippet: Some moderate Republican and independent women — a key swing group — have felt alienated by the focus in the presidential race on abortion and birth control.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rob Davis from San Diego, Dan Frosch from Denver, Ian Lovett from Los Angeles, Malia Wollan from San Francisco and Steven Yaccino from Chicago. Allison Kopicki contributed analysis.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s campaign will use the debate over the new health care law to amplify an appeal that seems to be benefiting from clashes on birth control and abortion.

headline.main: Obama Plans Big Effort to Build Support Among Women
headline.print_headline: Obama Campaign Plans Big Effort to Court Women

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's re-election campaign has begun an intensified effort to build support among women, using the debate over the new health care law to amplify an appeal that already appears to be benefiting from partisan clashes over birth control and abortion; will send mailings to one million women in more than a dozen battleground states, alongside efforts to organize phone banks, campus activities and media events; women's vote, which made up 53 percent of the electorate in 2008, is seen as essential to Pres Obama's re-election prospects.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s campaign will use the debate over the new health care law to amplify an appeal that seems to be benefiting from clashes on birth control and abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: An examination by The Bay Citizen has found that many of these districts stockpile vast reserves and divert money to administrative and operating expenses.

headline.seo: As Uninsured Go Without, California Health Districts Hold Reserves
headline.main: As the Uninsured Go Without Care, Health Districts Hold Reserves of Money
headline.print_headline: As the Uninsured Go Without Care, Health Districts Hold Reserves of Money

docs.snippet: An examination by The Bay Citizen has found that many of these districts stockpile vast reserves and divert money to administrative and operating expenses.

byline.original: By JENNIFER GOLLAN and KATHARINE MIESZKOWSKI

docs.lead_paragraph: ROME -- When five officials from Italy's internal revenue service entered the Dal Duca restaurant in Rome's trendy Trastevere neighborhood one night two weeks ago, they were not there to eat. Instead, over three hours the tax collectors interviewed the staff, took a look at the books and then checked out the cash register receipts at the end of a busy night of dinner service.

headline.main: Italy Intensifies Its All-Out War on Tax Evaders

docs.abstract: Italian officials have opened a new, all-out war against tax evaders, hoping to close Italy's $2.5 trillion public debt and revive a frail economy that has been buffeted by the euro crisis; in addition to banning cash transactions, it has included an ad campaign comparing tax evaders to parasites. Photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials said they would give states wide discretion on details, but would set up and operate exchanges if states refused to do so.

headline.seo: Obama Administration to Set Health Care Exchange Rules
headline.main: Health Care Exchange Rules to Be Set
headline.print_headline: Health Care Exchange Rules to Be Set

docs.abstract: Obama administration will issue standards for health insurance exchanges, markets where consumers and small businesses will be able to buy coverage from competing private plans, a major provision of the new health care law; federal officials say they will give state officials broad discretion to decide the operational details, but make clear they will set up and operate an exchange in any state that refuses to do so.
docs.snippet: Federal officials said they would give states wide discretion on details, but would set up and operate exchanges if states refused to do so.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich have largely bypassed Kansas, and Rick Santorum is using his position there to encourage his supporters to turn out in large numbers.

headline.seo: Solid in Kansas, Santorum Rallies for Lots of Votes
headline.main: Solid in Kansas, Santorum Seeks to Build Margin
headline.print_headline: Solid in Kansas, Santorum Seeks to Build Margin

docs.abstract: Republican presidential contender Rick Santorum tries to motivate his supporters in Kansas to give him a big victory in the state's caucuses, largely bypassed by rivals Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich, in order to build momentum for contests in the Deep South.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich have largely bypassed Kansas, and Rick Santorum is using his position there to encourage his supporters to turn out in large numbers.

byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson contributed reporting from Birmingham, Ala.

docs.lead_paragraph: Want to know why we can’t get the dog-on-the-roof story straightened out? Just look at the latest happenings in Mittworld.

headline.seo: The Bad News Is Good News
headline.main: The Bad News Is Good News
headline.print_headline: The Bad News Is Good News

docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column criticizes Mitt Romney for supporting the Republican proposal to allow employers to refuse to provide health care coverage for contraception if they have moral objections to birth control; asserts that the good news is that the more the party argues over the issue, the more it loses votes, money and sympathy.
docs.snippet: Want to know why we can’t get the dog-on-the-roof story straightened out? Just look at the latest happenings in Mittworld.

docs.lead_paragraph: A senior fellow at the Family Research Council says Linda Greenhouse misunderstood her position on the Georgetown University contraception debate.
docs.snippet: A senior fellow at the Family Research Council says Linda Greenhouse misunderstood her position on the Georgetown University contraception debate.

headline.print_headline: Closing the Gap Between Rich and Poor

docs.lead_paragraph: Many patients fear tangling with a litigious doctor, or being blackballed by the profession after a negative review of one of its members.

headline.seo: Why the Web Lacks Authoritative Reviews of Doctors
headline.main: The Web Is Awash in Reviews, but Not for Doctors. Here’s Why.
headline.print_headline: The Web Is Awash in Reviews, but Not for Doctors. Here’s Why.

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column elaborates on why there is no widespread online system for reviewing physicians, as there are for restaurants, hotels and other services; contends that many patients are reluctant to provide in-depth reviews of their doctors, largely out of fear that the doctor will find out.
docs.snippet: Many patients fear tangling with a litigious doctor, or being blackballed by the profession after a negative review of one of its members.
